org.treetank.service.xml.xpath.functions
Class AbsFunction

java.lang.Object
  org.treetank.axis.AbsAxis
      org.treetank.service.xml.xpath.expr.AbsExpression
          org.treetank.service.xml.xpath.functions.AbsFunction
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterable<Long>, Iterator<Long>
Direct Known Subclasses:
FNBoolean, FNCount, FNNot, FNPosition, FNString, FNSum
public abstract class AbsFunction
extends AbsExpression

AbstractFunction

Abstract super class for all function classes.

All functions that extend the abstract class only need take care of the result computation. Everything else, like checking if arguments are valid and adding the result with the corresponding type to the transaction list is done by the abstract super class.

Developer Example

   Must extend <code>AbstractFunction</code> and implement <code>IAxis</code>.
   And the implement the abstract method computeResult(), that returns the 
   computed value as a bye-array
   
   
   
   public class ExampleFunctionAxis extends AbstractFunction implements IAxis {
  
     public ExampleAxis(final INodeReadTrx rtx, final List<IAxis> args,
       final int min, final int max, final int returnType) {
       // Must be called as first.
       super(rtx, args, min, max, returnType);
     }
     protected byte[] computeResult() {
       .... compute value and return as byte array
     }
   
   }

Constructor Detail

AbsFunction

public AbsFunction(INodeReadTrx rtx,
                   List<AbsAxis> args,
                   int min,
                   int max,
                   int returnType)
            throws TTXPathException
Constructor. Initializes internal state and do a statical analysis concerning the function's arguments.

Parameters:
rtx - Transaction to operate on
args - List of function arguments
min - min number of allowed function arguments
max - max number of allowed function arguments
returnType - the type that the function's result will have
Throws:
TTXPathException - if the verify process is failing.
Method Detail

varifyParam

public final void varifyParam(int mNumber)
                       throws TTXPathException
Checks if the number of input arguments of this function is a valid according to the function specification in XQuery 1.0 and XPath 2.0 Functions and Operators. Throws an XPath error in case of a non-valid number.

Parameters:
mNumber - number of given function arguments
Throws:
TTXPathException - if function call fails.

public void reset(long mNodeKey)

evaluate

public AtomicValue evaluate()
                     throws TTXPathException
Performs the expression dependent evaluation of the expression. (Template method)

Specified by:
evaluate in class AbsExpression
Throws:
TTXPathException - if evaluation fails.

computeResult

protected abstract byte[] computeResult()
                                 throws TTXPathException
Computes the result value of the function. This implementation is acts as a hook operation and needs to be overridden by the concrete function classes, otherwise an exception is thrown.

Returns:
value of the result
Throws:
TTXPathException - if anythin odd happens while execution

getArgs

protected List<AbsAxis> getArgs()
Returns:
the list of function arguments
